node.title: First-term MP to replace Vickie Chapman as Attorney-General in SA Government
node.description: Adelaide Hills backbencher MP Josh Teague will be sworn in as South Australia's Attorney-General tomorrow, replacing Vickie Chapman.
node.content: ["Adelaide Hills backbencher Josh Teague will be sworn in as South Australia's Attorney-General tomorrow, replacing Vickie Chapman.", "Ms Chapman has resigned as deputy premier and stood aside as a minister while the state ombudsman investigates whether she had a conflict of interest in a ministerial decision to refuse a port on Kangaroo Island.", "A parliamentary committee last week ruled Ms Chapman did have a conflict and misled parliament.", "Both Ms Chapman and Premier Steven Marshall insist she had no conflict.", "However, Mr Marshall said his former deputy decided she could not continue as Attorney-General while under investigation by the ombudsman, a position she oversees.", "Mr Marshall said Josh Teague would take on Ms Chapman's portfolios of Attorney-General, planning and local government when sworn in as a minister tomorrow.", "The first-term MP and lawyer was speaker of the House of Assembly until last month, when Liberal defector Dan Cregan seized the speakership in a late-night coup.", "The Liberal Party's Lower House MPs will meet in the coming days to select a new deputy premier.", "More to come."]
